title: 820-00165 Strange Issue, help!
message:
820-00165

The Logic Board does not turn on, when attached to my power supply it will take 30Mah, then quickly 19Mah, then to about 160 for a split second, then back to 30. I have narrowed down the problem to U8080, and the PP5V_S4R3 rail. It seems like there is a short to ground, however I have checked every connection to this and there is no short. PP5V_S4R3 will go to 0V, then to about 2V for a split second (when it goes it 160 mAH). When I remove U8080, this goes away, and the board stays at 160mah, when removed I checked every connection and no short.

PM_SLP_S4_L will sometimes be there, it has occurred twice now where when I measure R8116, and others around it, the board will be OK, and even when U8080 is there the logic board goes to 160mAH.

I can compare the symptoms to Louis Rossmanns PM_SLP_S4_L video, where the S4 and S3 rails are affected by this.

I have replaced U8080 twice, and have replaced U1950 too.

EDIT: When removing U8080, PM_SLP_S4 is present and working. As well as PP5V_S4R3, and P5VS0_EN (However it is at 3V, is this normal?)

EDIT: Got it working, however not fully, PP5V_S4R3 is good, however U7820 is not outputting P1V8S3_PGOOD. All voltages are present too, PP3V3_S5 (3.3V), PP1V8_S3 (3V), P1V8S3_FB (0.8V) , P1V8S3_SW, (1.8V)

title: 820-00165 Strange Issue, help!
message:
"Got it working, however not fully"
Do you mean the board stays on, but no activity?

"U7820 is not outputting P1V8S3_PGOOD"
Then you miss ALL_SYS_PWRGD, as VCORE too.
Remove R8166 and test again.

title: 820-00165 Strange Issue, help!
message:
Yep, sorry, Incorrect working. The board now pulls 150Mah, the new problem is U7820 is not outputting the PGOOD signal. Yes that means no ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

This board does not boot or power on, before the 5V rail was down, no fan spin, now that it is fixed we do get a fan spin.

WIll remove resistor then report back.

title: 820-00165 Strange Issue, help!
message: Removed resistor, still 0V, no short to ground on U7820 either, all power inputs on that chip are present and correct.

title: 820-00165 Strange Issue, help!
message:
If board stays on and ALL_SYS_PWRGD is 0V, then another power good signal pulls it down.

Check all signals involved in ALL_SYS_PWRGD generation.
Start removing Q8150; is a redundant protection...

title: 820-00165 Strange Issue, help!
message:
Sorry for this really late reply, I have solved the problem.

For future reference or for anyone who has this problem, it was R6130, it was measuring incorrectly in resistance.

I replaced it and board fully powers on now.
